Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2009 09:46PM justpeachy wrote: I was 42 when dx the first time Stage 11a, then here we go again at 44 this time Stage IV.......  I have 2 daughters age 20 and 25.  And I too struggle with the knowledge that this is genetic and could be passed to them.  I make it my mission in life to educate them about bc prevention, and the importance of being your own advocate for your health care.  I look back on the what if's in my life.  Back in 1994 I had surgery for a cyst on my ovary and the doc noticed a small pea on my right breast.  One doc suggested a needle biopsy, but the chief at the time didn't think it was necessary.....needless to say 10 years later the little pea grew and was not diagnosed until I found the lump.  It's been a wild ride ever since. Smile and Be Blessed!
Posts.Title: Poll - How old were you when dx with BC Times3 Minetta57

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2009 09:12PM justpeachy wrote: Hi Stephanie, I've just joined this community today and I want to encourage you to not let anyone bring negativity to your life.  Every day living with cancer is a struggle, a knock down, drag 'em out fight.  From the other post, I see that you have been such an inspiration to others.  It's so comforting to know that there are other's on this journey......we are not alone.  As a believer you know what we as believer's "wrestle against".  I pray that you find peace and comfort in knowing that God IS able....we don't understand but we must in faith trust that he's working this situation out for the good.  Cancer stinks!!!!  But I'm determined to not let it have the best parts of me.....my faith, my love and my joy.  Be blessed my sister.
Posts.Title: I'm Done TripleNeg AliceJean
